application.name: ascii2isis
application.brief: Import ascii file as a cube
application.description: This program will read an ascii file and create a cube. The ascii values can be delimited by spaces, tabs, commas or any other character that is not a number, a period, or a plus or minus sign.

history.change: Fixed problems with mixed separators. Added appTest.
Added ability to change special pixel ranges. Added example.

parameter.name: FROM
parameter.description: The file name of the input ascii file to be converted to cube.

parameter.name: TO
parameter.description: The file name of the output cube.

parameter.name: ORDER
parameter.description: Storage order of image data defines which dimension varies the fastest and the third varying the slowest (sample, line or band). BSQ = Band Sequential (sample, line, band) BIL = Band Interleaved by Line (sample, band, line) BIP = Band Interleaved by Pixel (band, sample, line)

option.description: The data is stored with the sample dimension varying the fastest, followed by the line dimension, then the band dimension. All samples for the first line are followed by all samples for the second line and so on until the final line for band 1. This pattern is then repeated for each band.

option.brief: Band Interleaved by Line (sample, band, line)
option.description: The data is stored with the sample dimension varying the fastest, followed by the band dimension, then the line dimension. All samples for line 1 band 1 are followed by all samples for line 1 band 2 and so on until the final band. This pattern is then repeated for each line.

option.brief: Band Interleaved by Pixel (band, sample, line)
option.description: The data is stored with the band dimension varying the fastest, followed by the sample dimension, then the line dimension. Sample 1 for all bands are followed by sample 2 for all bands and so on for all samples for line 1. This pattern is then repeated for each line.

parameter.name: SAMPLES
parameter.description: This defines the number of samples in the ascii.

parameter.name: LINES
parameter.brief: Number of lines in raw image
parameter.description: This defines the number of lines in the raw image.

parameter.name: BANDS
parameter.brief: Number of bands in raw image
parameter.description: This defines the number of bands in the raw image. If greater than 1, the image is assumed to be in band sequential order.

parameter.name: SKIP
parameter.brief: Number of bytes to skip before reading data
parameter.description: This defines the number of bytes to skip before the actual image data is read. This would be for raw images with header data.

parameter.name: SETNULLRANGE
parameter.description: If this option is used input raw pixels below minimum and above maximum will be converted to LRS and HRS respectively. Otherwise pixels in the input raw file will be left unchanged in most cases. For example, importing a raw 8-bit file and outputing to a 16-bit or 32-bit real will cause 0 and 255 to be actual values. If left as 8-bit then 0 will be NULL and 255 will be HRS.

parameter.name: NULLMIN
parameter.description: Minimum valid value. Anything below this value will be set to LRS.

parameter.name: NULLMAX
parameter.description: Maximum valid value. Anything above this value will be set to HRS.

parameter.name: SETHRSRANGE
parameter.description: If this option is used input raw pixels below minimum and above maximum will be converted to LRS and HRS respectively. Otherwise pixels in the input raw file will be left unchanged in most cases. For example, importing a raw 8-bit file and outputing to a 16-bit or 32-bit real will cause 0 and 255 to be actual values. If left as 8-bit then 0 will be NULL and 255 will be HRS.

parameter.name: HRSMIN
parameter.description: Minimum valid value. Anything below this value will be set to LRS.

parameter.name: HRSMAX
parameter.description: Maximum valid value. Anything above this value will be set to HRS.

parameter.name: SETLRSRANGE
parameter.description: If this option is used input raw pixels below minimum and above maximum will be converted to LRS and HRS respectively. Otherwise pixels in the input raw file will be left unchanged in most cases. For example, importing a raw 8-bit file and outputing to a 16-bit or 32-bit real will cause 0 and 255 to be actual values. If left as 8-bit then 0 will be NULL and 255 will be HRS.

parameter.name: LRSMIN
parameter.description: Minimum valid value. Anything below this value will be set to LRS.

parameter.name: LRSMAX
parameter.description: Maximum valid value. Anything above this value will be set to HRS.
